violentEvents.title: Bomb Explosion
violentEvents.description: A deafening explosion rocks the street ahead of you. Through the smoke and screaming, you see bodies scattered among the debris. Glass and concrete rain down as car alarms wail. The acrid smell of explosives mixes with something worse.

choices.consequence: You ignore your own safety and dive into the chaos. The sight of mangled bodies will haunt your dreams, but you help save three lives that day. The grateful families remember your courage.
Your survival instincts kick in and you run. You hear the cries for help behind you, but self-preservation wins. You're safe, but the guilt gnaws at you.
Your journalist training takes over. The photos you capture will tell the world about this atrocity, but documenting such horror changes something inside you.

violentEvents.title: Sectarian Killing
violentEvents.description: You witness a man being dragged from his car by masked figures. His pleas for mercy are cut short by gunshots. His crime was being on the wrong side of the peace wall at the wrong time. The killers melt away into the night, leaving only silence and blood.

choices.consequence: You memorize faces and details, knowing this information could be dangerous. The weight of being a witness to murder settles on your shoulders like a lead blanket.
You keep walking, eyes fixed ahead. In this world, selective blindness is often the price of survival. But forgetting what you've seen is harder than expected.

violentEvents.title: Police Brutality
violentEvents.description: RUC officers have cornered a teenager against a wall. Their batons rise and fall with sickening thuds. The boy's cries echo off the brick walls as blood streams down his face. 'This is what happens to fenian scum,' one officer growls.

choices.consequence: You step forward despite the danger. The beating stops, but now you're marked as a troublemaker. The boy lives, but you've made powerful enemies.
You shout about a fire down the street. The officers are momentarily distracted, giving the boy a chance to escape. It's not much, but it's something.
You hurry past, trying to block out the sounds. Sometimes the price of involvement is too high to pay. The guilt follows you home.

moralDilemmas.title: The Informant's Offer
moralDilemmas.description: A nervous man slides into the seat beside you. 'I know who you are,' he whispers. 'I can keep certain people from asking questions about you... for a price. Information. Nothing that would hurt innocents, just operational details.'

choices.consequence: You cross a line that can never be uncrossed. The protection is real, but so is the price to your soul. You're safer, but you're also a traitor.

choices.text: Refuse and threaten to expose him
choices.consequence: The informant pales and hurries away. You've maintained your integrity, but you've also made a dangerous enemy who knows your secrets.
You nod noncommittally and excuse yourself. The informant watches you leave with calculating eyes. This conversation isn't over.

moralDilemmas.title: The Weapons Cache
moralDilemmas.description: While searching the cellar, you discover a hidden cache of weapons and explosives. Among them is a bomb that matches the description of one used in last week's attack that killed civilians. Your fingerprints are now on the evidence.

choices.consequence: You make an anonymous call to the police. The raid happens at dawn. Some will call you a hero, others a traitor. The line between right and wrong has never been blurrier.

choices.text: Leave everything as you found it
choices.consequence: You carefully replace everything and try to forget what you saw. But the knowledge burns inside you like acid. How many more will die because of your silence?
Working by candlelight, you dismantle what you can. It's not a solution, but it might prevent some deaths. The risk of discovery keeps you awake for weeks.

moralDilemmas.title: A Misleading Leaflet
moralDilemmas.description: You find a stack of freshly printed leaflets accusing a local shopkeeper, known for being neutral, of being an informant for the British Army. The claims seem baseless and designed to ruin his life. A group of youths is preparing to distribute them.

choices.text: Intervene and try to convince the youths the leaflet is poison.
choices.consequence: You point out the lies and urge them to stop. A few walk away uncertain, but others glare, branding you a sympathizer. Word spreads quickly.

choices.text: Walk away and let the man's reputation be destroyed, ensuring your own safety.
choices.consequence: You leave them to it, trying not to think about the damage those papers will do. Guilt settles in as the shouts fade behind you.

moralDilemmas.title: Loyalist Demands
moralDilemmas.description: At a back-room meeting, hardline loyalists ask you to use your civil service job to sabotage housing applications from Catholic neighborhoods.

choices.consequence: You make excuses and get out as quickly as possible. Word spreads you might not be fully committed.
You agree, gaining protection from loyalists but losing your integrity.
They warn you that you're making powerful enemies. For now, they let you leave.

moralDilemmas.title: Threatening Phone Call
moralDilemmas.description: An anonymous caller warns you to stop digging into a recent bombing. They know where you are staying.

choices.consequence: Fear grips you but your resolve hardens. You double-check the locks on your door before heading out.
Your editor urges caution and promises to look into additional security. It's some comfort.

choices.text: Lay low and avoid further reporting
choices.consequence: You decide a story isn't worth your life. Another journalist might pick it up, but you feel defeated.

randomEncounters.title: Random Search
randomEncounters.description: The soldiers motion you over for a more thorough inspection. They empty your pockets and question your purpose in the area.

choices.consequence: Your cooperation is noted. The search reveals nothing suspicious, and you're allowed to continue.
Your attitude is noted as 'uncooperative.' The search becomes more thorough and humiliating, but they find nothing.
